description: Product of digits of n-th prime.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(25) = 63 because the 25th prime is 97, and 9 * 7 = 63.a(26) = 0 because the 26th prime is 101, and 1 * 0 * 1 = 0.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {d = digits(prime(n), 10); return (prod(i=1, #d, d[i]));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 12 2013(MAGMA) [&*Intseq(NthPrime(n)): n in [1..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 15 2014
author: _Enoch Haga_, Feb 16 2000
